metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5158 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in vringh_kiov_advance in drivers/vhost/vringh.c in the host side of a virtio ring in the Linux Kernel. This issue may result in a denial of service from guest to host via zero length descriptor.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

No subscription required
